title: Not sure I understand Victorious Maokai
body:
If you needed a non-human character for the Victorious slot this year, you could have at least gone with Rek'sai. Would go a long way towards the Rek'sai mains getting over how much you butchered their champion for the sake of Pro Play.

I thought the victorious skin went to whoever made the biggest impact in pro play this year? That's why last year it was Sivir and the year before it was Morgana, and so on

replies.body: Honestly why didn't they give it to a champion idk... that people actually play. That dumb ass tree has a 2% pick rate. Also, on top of that people want a fun champion to get the victorius skin, and a champ that has mechanics. Not this boosted ass tree champion that has barley any depth (all you do is go tanky and root) I think this was a bad pick. You mention it might have needed to be a non-human pick right? Well why don't they pick kha, rek, or even tham, or they could have picked a champion with a high pick rate Yasuo, lee, nid, zed, vayne, riven, or hey even better anyone but a tree.

It has literally nothing to do with cash cow champions. It's an arbitrary choice for a champion to get this skin. Maokai did fuck all this season. Ekko alone did more than Maokai did, as did many other champions. If we're being real, it should have gone to Shen

I think they just looked back at how much he did for season 5, and in the Spring of 6 which was the last time he was really relevant. So they decided to give it to him now since they didn't last season as the community was really hoping for an ADC (Sivir).

He hovered around 50-80 pb rate at summer split depending on region. But regardless, there are at least 10 champs that are not junglers or supports (that already got 2 each) that had more influence this season. I hate ekko with passion but i also beleive he is the best candidate.

Edit: I woult rank (and really love) Karma as first but she is support. And i encourage diversity for skins.

Riot has started the champion that get's the Victorius skin is the champion that had the most impact on the season... that being said maokai did not really have any impact this season, and even if he did it sure as shit was not more then rek'sai, nidalee, rumble, cass, syndra, ahri, etc. I mean im not going to lie I would like another Riven skin because she is a fun champion and a lot of people play her unlike maokai. Rek'sai would have been a bad choice in my opinion considering that she doesn't have that many skins to begin with.
Doesn't that make it an even better choice?

No. Elise got Victorious Elise while she still only had her release skin and Riot said that releasing "unavailable skins" like that is something they plan on never doing again (and thus rules out and champion released in the past year almost). Elise had to wait until Blood Moon to actually get a second skin since only 50% of the ranked player base had her only other available skin.

I see. I would say "but just release a new skin shortly after" but then they would lose half of their customers on that skin because they prefer their victorious one. I suppose that the first few skins of each champion are also the best selling ones. So when they have to give a skin for free, it makes sense from a business standpoint to put it on a champ with a lot of skins, one that's already milked out.

Yeah, about that: Remember when Riot set the standards for each new price tag, and Arcade Sona and Taric of the 5th age jumped up to a price tier they didn't really qualify for, as a result them being high sellining skins? Riot's word doesn't amount to much in that regard.

Wouldn't say that considering that the skin will be lost forever for whoever didn't manage to get it this year.

If its a champ though who has already a good amunt of skins,then its not such a big loss for people who don't get the skin.

Indeed. If the champion has a decent amount of skins its usually better for them to receive the Victorious skin. Where as in season 3, we got Victorious Elise as her first skin after release causing people to rage afterwards when she had no other skins outside of Death blossom and thus Riot said that would never happen again.

So Maokai having this, isn't a bad thing, even though there are plenty of others that could fit into that as well, but he'll still have plenty of options for the people that do not receive the skin.

It's whoever makes the most impact on pro play near the beginning of the season. The mid-season competitions are sort of a later deadline for when they need to finish deciding on it so they can go ahead and make the skin.
